thread.title: Local restaurants compete to help Fort Mill High School ‘sting cancer’
thread.title_full: Local restaurants compete to help Fort Mill High School ‘sting cancer’

author: From staff reports
title: Local restaurants compete to help Fort Mill High School ‘sting cancer’
text:
Local restaurants compete to help Fort Mill High School ‘sting cancer’ 
50 percent of orders will be donated 
There’s a variety of dishes and styles to choose from 
You can eat good food for a good cause Order the shrimp and grits at Local Dish in October and the resturant will donate 50 percent of the proceeds to Fort Mill High’s Stinging Cancer fundraiser. Other local restaurants also are sharing proceeds from select dishes. Fort Mill Times File i Order Reprint of this Story 
As Breast Cancer Awareness Month continues, Fort Mill High School is “Stinging Cancer” with the Yellow Jackets’ Restaurant Wars. The following local restaurants are donating 50 percent of the cost of the following orders to the school’s fundraising effort for the American Cancer Society: 
▪ Empire Pizza: Bruschetta pizza (any size) 
▪ Local Dish: Shrimp and grits 
▪ Charanda Mexican Grill and Cantina: Mango salmon 
▪ Towne Tavern: Buffalo and chicken Cabrese wrap 
▪ Danny’s Pizza: $5 donated for any school-ordered 18-inch pizza 
▪ Zaxby’s: Birthday cake shake 
▪ Smoothie King: Medium Angel Food smoothie 
▪ Hobo’s: Pink Weekly Special 
▪ Beef O’Brady’s: Fort Mill Build Your Own Burger 
The restaurant with the highest donation will be recognized at a home basketball game in November. 
Earlier this month, Fort Mill and Nation Ford high schools teamed up for the annual Pink-Out football game and raised money for the A Crucial Catch Campaign, a partnership between the American Cancer Society and the NFL. For more information, email fmhspinkout@gmail.com . Related content
